lead_paragraph: All of the workers in a proposed office tower in Midtown Manhattan will be paid at least $13.30 an hour, the first broad application of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s executive order mandating a living wage.

headline.print_headline: Under Deal, Living Wage for Workers at a Tower
headline.main: Under Deal, Living Wage for Workers at a Tower in Hudson Yards

snippet: All of the workers in a proposed office tower in Midtown Manhattan will be paid at least $13.30 an hour, the first broad application of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s executive order mandating a living wage.
abstract: New York City officials say all workers in proposed office tower in Hudson Yards project in Midtown Manhattan will be paid $13.30 an hour under deal struck with Brookfield Property Partners; deal, first involving construction project that has applied for city tax breaks, points to Mayor Bill de Blasio's progressive agenda.
